# The Cookbook
In this section of the Guidebook, you will find most recipes you can cook, and below is an overview of ingredients as well as basic foodstuffs used throughout other categories.
## Ingredients
[color=#a4885c]Grains and sugar[/color] will be a mainstay in any chef's menu. They are normally grown in Hydroponics and then processed in the grinder.
[color=#a4885c]Fruits and vegetables[/color] are also a common part of cuisine and can often be eaten directly, and some, like pineapple, can be sliced.
[color=#a4885c]Meat[/color] is acquired from most any carcass. Smaller creatures can simply be butchered with any sharp instrument by right-clicking them and clicking the [color=#a4885c]Butcher[/color] option. Larger ones need to be impaled on a [color=#a4885c]meat spike[/color] and then cut into portions with a [color=#a4885c]knife[/color]. [color=#888084]Be careful about answering questions of the meat's origins, though.[/color]
Meat can be processed into animal protein in the grinder, or can be sliced with a knife into [color=#a4885c]cutlets[/color].
Protein can be used raw, but sometimes has to be cooked beforehand. Simply microwave it for 10 seconds, or use a [color=#a4885c]hotplate[/color].
[color=#a4885c]Dairy[/color] is another big part of humanoid diet. A [color=#a4885c]cow[/color] is often provided, which can be milked, though it has to be fed fruit or wheat and water on occasion to keep lactating. [color=#a4885c]Cheese[/color] and [color=#a4885c]butter[/color] are made in reaction between milk and [color=#a4885c]universal enzyme[/color] or [color=#a4885c]salt[/color], respectively. [color=#fcdf03]The latter is a catalyst and is not consumed by making dairy products.[/color] Cheese can be sliced into [color=#a4885c]wedges[/color].
[color=#a4885c]Soy milk[/color] is available, but is usually not a substitute for regular milk. There are other foods one can make of it, however.
- One [color=#a4885c]egg[/color] usually contains 6u of egg liquid, but depending on the source, they may contain less or more. If recipes with eggs don't work, crack them into a vessel to be sure that you have enough.
## Basic Foods
[color=#a4885c]Cheese Wheel[/color]
- 40u milk - 5u univerzal enzyme (c)
[color=#a4885c]Curd Cheese[/color]
- 15u milk - 5u vinegar - 5u cream
[color=#a4885c]Mozzarella Cheese[/color]
- 15u milk - 10u cream - 5u univerzal enzyme (c)
[color=#a4885c]Butter[/color]
- 30u milk - 5u salt (c)
[color=#a4885c]Dough[/color]
- 15u water - 10u flour
[color=#a4885c]Bread[/color]
[color=#a4885c]Bun[/color]
[color=#a4885c]Meatball[/color]
- 3u raw animal protein - 5u flour - 1/3 of an egg
[color=#a4885c]Salami[/color]
- 18u cooked protein - 10u salt - 5u water
[color=#a4885c]Tofu[/color]
- 30u soy milk - 5u univerzal enzyme (c)
